description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5tqgq","text":"The enteric nervous system is an important regulator of gastrointestinal, digestive and metabolic function. Here we describe protocols for clearing rat gastric tissue with the Clearing-enhanced 3D microscopy (Ce3D) method to increase optical clarity, to allow the use of thick tissue preparations for quantitation of the number and size of myenteric and submucosal ganglia in the rat fundus, corpus and antrum","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: ,rat, ganglia, myenteric plexus, submucosal plexus, corpus, antrum, fundus, Hu,immunohistochemistry

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fdiuo","text":"Experiments were conducted on male and female Sprague-Dawley rats of 6.5-8 weeks (175-220 g female, 220-360 g male). Procedures were approved by the University of Melbourne Animal Ethics Committee. Rats were supplied with food and water ad libitum prior to the experiments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3uulr","text":"Rats were deeply anaesthetised with a mixture of ketamine (55 mg/kg) and xylazine (9 mg/kg) prior to being perfused transcardially with heparinised phosphate buffered saline (PBS: 0.15M NaCl, 0.01M sodium phosphate buffer, pH 7.2) followed by fixative (2% formaldehyde, 0.2% picric acid in 0.1M sodium phosphate buffer, pH 7.0). The stomach was removed, dissected, and post-fixed overnight at 4°C in the same fixative, before being cleared with 3 x 10 min washes in dimethyl sulfoxide, 3 x 10 min washes in PBS and then stored in PBS-azide (0.1% sodium azide in PBS) at 4°C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7pera","text":"      -  Recommend carrying out incubations in a suitably sized tissue culture plate so that tissue can remain flat while being fully immersed in a small volume of solution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4f2f","text":"      -  Plates should be placed in a humid box to prevent evaporation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7l5su","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aflbd","text":"•     Place tissue in blocking buffer (PBS-azide with 0.3% (v/v) Triton X-100, 1% (v/v) BSA, and 1% (v/v) normal horse serum) to block for 24hr at 37°C ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4u23r","text":"      -  Use enough solution to easily cover the tissue","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"817bi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nn5h","text":"•     Place tissue in primary antibody (human anti-Hu 1:4000 in PBS-azide with 0.3% (v/v) Triton X-100, 1% (v/v) BSA, and 1% (v/v) normal horse serum) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5np73","text":"      -  Use enough solution to cover the tissue","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vc2k","text":"      -  Incubate in a humid box for 4 days at 37°C then 1 day at room temperature (RT).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mqqm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bj8g","text":"•     From this point on - work inside a chemical fumehood for all steps, collect all waste into labelled Ce3D waste container.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ngg6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bu581","text":"•     Wash tissues with Ce3D washing buffer (PBS-azide with 0.3% (v/v) Triton X-100 and 0.5% (v/v) 1-thioglycerol) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43o51","text":"Use an excess volume of wash buffer for all washes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6o5ov","text":"      -  3 x 30min washes at RT followed by 1 wash overnight at RT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3f4ts","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5o1oq","text":"•     Place tissue in secondary antibody (donkey anti-human 594 1:250 in PBS-azide with 0.3% (v/v) Triton X-100). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crj49","text":"      -  Use enough solution to cover the tissue","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5epd1","text":"      -  From this point on, protect from light during all incubations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"nsoh","text":"      -  Incubate in a humid box for 2 days at 37°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"anhgb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3rf4l","text":"•     Wash tissues with Ce3D washing buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aeb1k","text":"      -  3 x 30min washes at RT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3sgq","text":"      -  Replace with fresh Ce3D washing buffer and incubate the plates at RT for a further 2 days, changing the buffer every 24hr.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cv739","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4be3","text":"•     Prepare Ce3D clearing solution (22% (w/v) N-methylacetamide, 86% (w/v) Histodenz, 0.1% (v/v) Triton X-100, 0.5% (v/v) 1- thioglycerol) while tissue is washing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"t26u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hocm","text":"•     Gently dab the samples on a Kimwipe to eliminate excess washing buffer and place the samples directly into the Ce3D clearing solution ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3mds1","text":"      -  Use enough solution to easily cover the tissue","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ac6gs","text":"      -  Note which side of the tissue is facing up (muscle or mucosa) as this is harder to identify after clearing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tdtj","text":"      -  Incubate at RT for 3 days, change into fresh Ce3D clearing solution every 24hr","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66ej9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"18k88","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2s6ro","text":"•     Mount the samples onto slides with fresh Ce3D clearing solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8c1kv","text":"      -  Due to the thickness of the tissue and the fact that the mounting media does not set, you will need a spacer to form a frame around the tissue between the slide and the cover slip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"33pc9","text":"      -  Recommend 3D printing a frame - the outer edge approximately the size of your coverslip, 1-2mm thick depending on your tissue. Ensure top and bottom surfaces are smooth before mounting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4j4kp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dal8","text":"     Superglue the spacer to the slide ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ic3k","text":"      -  Fill the inside of the frame with fresh Ce3D clearing solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fq1gv","text":"      -  Place tissue into the Ce3D clearing solution, ensure muscle side of the tissue is facing up, and that tissue is flat","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29sp7","text":"      -  Place small drops of superglue on the spacer and carefully apply the top coverslip, avoid bubbles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7evbf","text":"      -  Seal the edges and hold in place with multiple coats of nail polish.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7hdi8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98oq7","text":"•     The mounted samples can be stored in the dark at RT for up to 1 week.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

The colors visualized are generated at random, however the color pixel value (if you measure the maximum grey value) will be a unique value for each object within that image and can be used as an identifier.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":15,"length":32},{"style":"bold","offset":50,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvg2n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a44un","text":"The aim is to use the two masks to generate a set of 3D objects which most accurately represents all MP ganglia and all SMP ganglia from the original image, and then collect measurement data from those 3D objects.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbp4v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3mqu7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6upi1","text":"Open template excel file and rename sam-xxx_ses-hu594.xlsx","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2pv7m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ueo8","text":"Open ImageJ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4q01q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dm3te","text":"•     ImageJ \u003e Analyze \u003e Set Measurements","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ptqo","text":"      - {"blocks":[{"key":"1jh3m","text":"Quantitation of rat gastric enteric ganglia","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":43},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76d66","text":"\n\nQuantification was completed in ImageJ using Fiji v1.53c, (https://fiji.sc/) with two additional plugins, 3D ImageJ Suite (Ollion et al., 2013) and MorphoLib (Legland et al. 2016)(available online).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":60,"length":1},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":77,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":61,"length":16}],"data":{}},{"key":"blnrq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ek95b","text":"• Ollion, J. et al., Bioinformatics, 29, 1840-1841 (2013)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":21,"length":15},{"style":"bold","offset":37,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ert1r","text":"• Legland, D. et al., Bioinformatics, 32, 2532-2534 (2016) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":22,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":38,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"773to","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3hf0","text":"A code was written to automate the image analysis, Ganglia macro.ijm (code). This script applies a given threshold and then applies filters to smooth and remove small particles from the image and generates a mask (or binary image) of the immunoreactivity selected. This mask contains 3 dimensional (3D) objects, representing any positive staining generated above the given threshold. Objects with greater than 20 µm distance separating them are defined as regions of interest (roi) representing individual ganglia. Within each image, a unique intensity value is assigned to each ganglia roi, which can be used as an identifier.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6i5a3","text":"For each image, the script is run twice, each time with a specific threshold is set by the experimenter which represents the immunoreactivity of the antibodies, to ensure that both low intensity and high intensity staining is captured accurately.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9ifp","text":"Ganglia roi from the two thresholds were manually checked against each other and against the original image to remove duplications and artefacts, and to also be assigned as either MP or SMP as defined by their position in the z stack. Two final masks are generated, a set of ganglia roi which most accurately represents all myenteric plexus (MP) ganglia and another for all the submucosa plexus (SMP) ganglia from the original image.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahp9","text":"Ganglia roi are then used to collect volume measurements (3D) from the z stack images, or to collect ganglia profile area measurements (2D) after projecting the z-stacks into a single image. The total area of the image was also measured for calculating ganglia density. Measurement data was then exported from ImageJ into excel and calculations were completed to determine ganglia areas and number of neurons per ganglia throughout all three regions of the stomach. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56gpd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tlmk","text":"See below for a more detailed description of these steps:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"250775A2772611ECBDCF0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://fiji.sc"}}}}
